title: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp admits he has big expectations for Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain
text:
Jurgen Klopp has urged Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain to raise his levels again in order to meet the lofty expectations Liverpool's manager has for his midfielder.

Oxlade-Chamberlain sparkled in Liverpool's 4-1 Champions League victory over Genk, scoring two goals in a game for the first time since October 2016.

It was the kind of performance he needed following 12 months on the sidelines due to having his right knee reconstructed.

Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain impressed for Liverpool in their 4-1 win over Genk on Wednesday

It is unlikely to keep the 26-year-old in the team for Sunday's crucial date with Tottenham, as Klopp was worried about how open his midfield was in Genk.

As a result, Jordan Henderson and Gini Wijnaldum will return and the German's message for Oxlade-Chamberlain is that he must strive to improve.

'Ox had a very serious injury but he is now a long time back,' said Klopp.

Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp has urged his midfielder to raise his playing levels again

'The longer you are out the longer you need. In the best moments of your career you don't think too much, you just do. You feel the game and you use your skills. In rehab you get fit again but you lose your flow and rhythm.

'To be really reliable again, you need time. We never lost patience, why should we? It is more difficult for players not to lose patience because you still remember what you could do.

'It needs time. He made big steps in the last couple of weeks, but my expectation of Ox is pretty high. I'm impressed by the goals but know there is still more to come.'
description: Jurgen Klopp has urged English midfielder Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain to raise his levels again in order to meet the lofty expectations Liverpool's manager has for his midfielder.
authors: Dominic King For The Daily Mail
